a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income inequality: Gini coefficient (after tax), 1956 to 2014
The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality. Inequality
is measured here in terms of income after taxes and benefits.
Data source: Chartbook of Economic Inequality (2017)
